cyclone.name: IAN
cyclone.current_location: about 615 miles ESE of Kingston, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to move west for the next day, then turn northwest across the northwestern Caribbean Sea, over or near western Cuba Monday night or early Tuesday, and continue toward the eastern Gulf of Mexico and the Florida peninsula mid-week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida west-central Gulf Coast (near the Tampa Bay / Port Manatee region)

weather_observation.watch_coast: No coastal watches are in effect yet.
weather_observation.warning_coast: No coastal warnings are in effect yet.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast from Naples northward to Apalachicola, including Tampa Bay and Port Manatee vicinity
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34–63 kt) are 36% likely within 5 days, with a 29% peak chance of beginning around 120 h; hurricane-force winds cannot yet be ruled out if the system intensifies faster than forecast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Early guidance suggests the potential for a 3–5 ft surge along the eastern side of Tampa Bay, including Port Manatee, if the center tracks just offshore at hurricane strength.
weather_observation.rainfall: Torrential rain bands associated with IAN could deposit 4–8 inches locally over west-central Florida, producing flash-flood potential in low-lying terminal areas and access roads.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes in outer rain bands and dangerous rip currents along coastal approaches.
